creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: ten total lines: eight lines of angular text, interspersed with swirling, elegant cursive; first two characters of first line boldly and distinctly written; two lines of text written at far left with space between them and the preceding text; first line at left very bold, with some bleeding of ink
title: Twenty-five Letters
